title: Mark Milley
added: On June 1, 2020, during [[George Floyd protests in Washington, D.C.|protests in Washington, D.C.]], in the wake of the [[killing of George Floyd]], Milley joined National Guardsmen and various police forces assembling in [[Lafayette Square, Washington, D.C.|Lafayette Square]], across the street from the [[White House]].<ref>{{Cite web|last=|first=|date=|title=The crackdown before Trump's photo op: How law enforcement cleared protesters outside the White House|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/investigations/2020/06/08/timeline-trump-church-photo-op/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-06-11|website=Washington Post|language=en}}</ref> Minutes later, the troops and police used [[tear gas]] and other [[riot control]] tactics to disperse peaceable protestors so Trump could stage a [[Donald Trump photo-op at St. John's Church|photo-op]] at nearby [[St. John's Episcopal Church, Lafayette Square|St. John's Episcopal Church]]. About half an hour after that, Milley, in combat uniform, walked alongside the president from the White House to the church, drawing sharp criticism from former military officers and others.<ref>{{Cite news|last=|first=|date=2020|title=Pentagon Distances Leaders From Trump Photo Op|work=US
